title: "Out of memory, getdelim failed" when using datalad save
body:
Trying to use `datalad` in a git-annex repo:

```bash
[castello@ndoli derivatives]$ datalad save -S -m "Add results on RSA GAT for Attention"
save(ok): /idata/DBIC/castello/hauntedhouse/data/derivatives (dataset)
save(ok): /idata/DBIC/castello/hauntedhouse/data (dataset)
[ERROR  ] Failed to run ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'add', '--dry-run', '-N', '--ignore-missing', '--verbose', '.'] under '/idata/DBIC/castello/hauntedhouse'. Exit code=128. out= err=fatal: Out of memory, getdelim failed
| fatal: 'git status --porcelain' failed in submodule data
|
Failed to run ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'add', '--dry-run', '-N', '--ignore-missing', '--verbose', '.'] under '/idata/DBIC/castello/hauntedhouse'. Exit code=128. out= err=fatal: Out of memory, getdelim failed
fatal: 'git status --porcelain' failed in submodule data
fatal: Out of memory, getdelim failed
fatal: 'git status --porcelain' failed in submodule data
```

Version info
```
[castello@ndoli derivatives]$ git annex version
git-annex version: 6.20170611-gb493ac8d3
build flags: Assistant Webapp Pairing Testsuite S3(multipartupload)(storageclasses) WebDAV Inotify DBus DesktopNotify ConcurrentOutput TorrentParser MagicMime Feeds Quvi
dependency versions: aws-0.14.1 bloomfilter-2.0.1.0 cryptonite-0.20 DAV-1.3.1 feed-0.3.11.1 ghc-8.0.1 http-client-0.4.31.1 persistent-sqlite-2.6 torrent-10000.0.0 uuid-1.3.12 yesod-1.4.3
key/value backends: SHA256E SHA256 SHA512E SHA512 SHA224E SHA224 SHA384E SHA384 SHA3_256E SHA3_256 SHA3_512E SHA3_512 SHA3_224E SHA3_224 SHA3_384E SHA3_384 SKEIN256E SKEIN256 SKEIN512E SKEIN512 SHA1E SHA1 MD5E MD5 WORM URL
remote types: git gcrypt p2p S3 bup directory rsync web bittorrent webdav tahoe glacier ddar hook external
local repository version: 5
supported repository versions: 3 5 6
upgrade supported from repository versions: 0 1 2 3 4 5
operating system: linux x86_64


[castello@ndoli derivatives]$ datalad --version
datalad 0.7.0
```

EDIT: memory is clearly not an issue
```
[castello@ndoli derivatives]$ free -h
              total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:           1.5T         20G        1.4T        162M        105G        1.5T
Swap:          4.0G          0B        4.0G
```
